item.description:
Every behavior, at its core, has a positive intention. -NLP presupposition.

Come watch a demonstration of how various NLP techniques can be used to bring about clarity, focus, and - in combination with Law-of-Attraction concepts - a mindset of financial success. This also will be a good opportunity to get answers to related questions you may have.

(If you plan to eat, please arrive by 6:30 pm to order; otherwise, by 7 pm will be fine.   There is no specified purchase minimum for refreshments, but participants are encouraged to order something to support the business, in appreciation of Management's permission to meet in their space.   Please be advised: Commercial eating establishments generally do not permit on-site consumption of refreshments brought in from elsewhere, due to liability concerns, so please be considerate.)

 

AGENDA

6:30 pm- Order dinner/refreshment if you plan to eat- $2.45 (for a soda) and upward

7:00 pm- Intro to neurolinguistic programming (NLP)

7:15 pm- Roots of clutter: Cluttered thinking

7:30 pm– Time Line and How It's Used

7:45 pm - Demonstration

8:30 pm- Q&A

8:45 pm- Wrap-up

 

Kevin Martin, a practicing certified hypnotherapist and neurolinguistic programming (NLP) Practitioner, will offer us frameworks for QUICKLY (on a scale of MINUTES- not months or years ... practically magic, rather like a "Gestalt switch") living beyond cluttered thinking- particularly regarding finances. As organizer of several Boston-area NLP Meetups, Kevin originally envisioned these groups would help people learn self-help tools. He often looks for resources, tools, and groups outside the fields of hypnosis and NLP to mesh with that vision -and fortunately, our group does!

 

WHAT TO BRING: Calendar to schedule Action Items (next steps), and a notepad & pen or other note-taking device. Dress in layers (e.g., wear a sweater in case the restaurant is cooler than you'd prefer) and comfortably, as Kevin might have us all do some NLP exercises.

 

Come join us!  (Or specify a better time and place for you to do so--)

 

NOTES:

This meeting is being offered on short notice because:

(1) Our February 2011 venue was so noisy and distracting that I embarked on a whirlwind Quest for More Suitable Venues, welcoming input- the sooner the better!  Our venue for this meeting is quite close to the MBTA- a short walk from the Red Line's Central and Kendall Square stations. Parking on-street or in a *city lot* nearby (e.g., lots accessible from Norfolk Street and Bishop Richard Allen Drive beside the Harvest Co-op in Central Square ... Cambridge Traffic, Parking & Transportation Dept. says these city lots are closest to our venue) is FREE AFTER 6 PM. The restaurant has been very quiet when I've checked its noise level during our usual meeting time on a Monday or Tuesday, and staff members have seemed accommodating. I've been told we can probably meet in the semi-private back room.

(2) This program is experimental: Kevin is developing NLP methods to help people address financial issues, and one or two demonstrations during our program will contribute to his research. Kevin will provide handouts highlighting major points covered, and says participants will take away enough to be a good value exchange for our time and monetary investments- I know that I certainly learned much from Kevin's February program at Alewife, as did that program's two demo subjects, judging from the feedback they provided; in fact, I continue to glean insights from that program, so I hope that you, too, can be part of this upcoming program ... perhaps as a subject for a demo?

 

MEETING FEE

The $10-per-person meeting fee (payable via PayPal or in cash at the event) helps to compensate the organizer and any presenter for their training and specialized knowledge shared, also for their time spent planning, coordinating, and administering the event, and to defray Meetup.com's charge assessed organizers to serve members each month, e.g., by hosting this web site and offering marketing tools. If you are late and/or miss a pre-paid event, pls note there will be NO REFUND. Please plan on being early, and allow for possible travel delays.

 

RECOMMENDED READINGS

Richard Bandler, Get the Life You Want
Richard Bandler's Guide to Trance-formation - EXCERPTS:

"...there is a magic moment when it all comes together, without effort."

"...if you learned to do something one way, you can learn how to do it totally different and better. Learning is the way to personal freedom. Hypnosis and NLP are tools to make this easy and fun."

-See more quotes and links to sample NLP/EFT video clips appended to our event posting for Thursday, February 24, 2011: "DECLUTTER YOUR THINKING *FAST*: Moving Beyond Clutter with NLP & EFT!"
item.how_to_find_us: Look for a red & white Meetup sign at our table
item.why: Opportunity to meet in a new, quiet location to "reframe" and learn other neurolinguistic programming (NLP) techniques. Come experience NLP in Action!

group.name: Tools for Decluttering, Personal Change & Goal Attainment

item.name: Living CLEAR: Clearing What's in Your Way to Financial Success
